thread.title: SAI orders age test for junior badminton players
thread.title_full: SAI orders age test for junior badminton players - The Times of India

author: Narain Swamy
title: SAI orders age test for junior badminton players
text:
BENGALURU: In a sweeping move, the Sports Authority of India has cracked the whip on age fraud racking badminton, subjecting the national teams for the Asia U-17 & U-15 Junior Championships to medical tests in a New Delhi hospital. 

Following complaints about overage players, fudging of certificates and various court orders, SAI ordered that all players selected for the continental championships, beginning in Kudus, central Java (Indonesia) from Monday had to mandatorily undergo bone age determination tests at the Ram Manohar Lohia hospital. The hospital follows the globally accepted Tanner Whithouse 3 (TW-3) method which apparently has an accuracy rate of around plus or minus six months. 

Asked whether this would be the norm in future, SAI director-general Injeti Srinivas replied in the affirmative. "We plan to extend such tests o all sports as soon as possible," he said. SAI was emboldened by a recent ruling by the Delhi High Court, which refused to interfere with the bone age determination method adopted by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) to ascertain age of players in the U-16 category. 

The court had pointed out on September 22 that BCCI couldn't be expected to have a method to verify the genuineness of documents given as proof of age by players and said the tests were conducted to "avoid discrimination between players and to ensure a level playing field in age group tournaments".
